Cocoa Buyers Start Cutting Off Purchases From Ivory Coast Updated: 16 minutes ago Cocoa traders are shutting down operations in Ivory Coast, in accordance with calls by the country's internationally recognised president-elect to put pressure on Laurent Gbagbo, the incumbent who has refused to step down, reports. This is a potentially critical development in the effort to put Alassane Ouattara , who the international community recognizes as the legitimate winner of last November's election, into office. Bushs of Benin, Sierra Leone and Cape Verde would visit Ivory Coast on Tuesday to inform Gbagbo that he must step down as quickly as possible or face legitimate military force .
